intro: Pennisetum angolense var. laxispicatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved fountain grass, is a perennial grass native to southern Africa. It features slender, arching stems that produce dense clusters of feathery, silver-green inflorescences. The plant is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it suitable for xeriscaping. Its foliage and flowering display add visual interest throughout the growing season.
